document_title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 6 for SLE 12 SP3)

document_notes.text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 6 for SLE 12 SP3)
document_notes.title: Topic

document_notes.text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 4.4.103-6_33 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2017-17712: The raw_sendmsg() function had a race condition that lead to uninitialized stack pointer usage. This allowed a local user to execute code and gain privileges (bsc#1073230).
document_notes.title: Details

relationship.relates_to_product_reference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 12 SP3

notes.text: The raw_sendmsg() function in net/ipv4/raw.c in the Linux kernel through 4.14.6 has a race condition in inet->hdrincl that leads to uninitialized stack pointer usage; this allows a local user to execute code and gain privileges.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
